abstract: Banks cannot cut deposit interest rates below zero, so plunging base rates have savaged liability spreads.
snippet: Banks cannot cut deposit interest rates below zero, so plunging base rates have savaged liability spreads.
lead_paragraph: Commercial lenders long for the days of “3-6-3”. That’s when bankers could borrow at 3 percent, lend at 6 percent and tee off on the golf course by 3 p.m. Now banks are trying to return to this pleasingly simple business model. Their first-half results show how hard it is.

headline.main: Thin Rate Spread Par for the Course

byline.original: By George Hay and Jeffrey Goldfarb
